alert.note: Alert for Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 8:47AM PST until January 07 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light to moderate snow is expected through this morning before tampering off by this afternoon. Additional snowfall accumulation of a dusting to an inch is possible through late this morning. Gusty northwest winds of 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 60 mph and localized gusts to 70 mph will continue through early this evening. * WHERE...Northern Ventura County Mountains and Interstate 5 Corridor in LA county mountains. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to low visibilities and snow/ice covered roads with localized blizzard conditions likely. Very strong winds may cause extensive tree damage. Interstate 5 near the Grapevine will likely become hazardous for driving tonight into Sunday morning due to the combination of snow, ice, and strong winds which may cause delays or closure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will likely come to a end by this afternoon, but strong winds will continue to cause reduced visibility at times due to blowing snow through this evening. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

area.areaDesc: Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains
